messages.content: SMAX is an acronym for "Submaximal Maximum Exercise Time." It is a measure of the longest time an individual can perform a submaximal exercise test before becoming exhausted or experiencing significant fatigue. SMAX can be used to assess the aerobic fitness of an individual and to help determine the intensity of an exercise program.
In the context of software products.

SMAX can refer to the maximum amount of time users should spend using a software product before they become bored or uninterested. It can also be used to measure the user experience of a software product and to determine the optimal level of engagement.
